channel.description: Recent content in tutorial on Richard's Lullaby

item.title: Install Pytorch for GPU and CPU using Conda on Windows
item.description: Install Anaconda or Miniconda depends on your taste. Go to anaconda or miniconda’s website and download the .sh file for your system. Go into the terminal use “chmod +x filename” command to the .sh file then run it. Always click yes to finish installation. Install jupyter conda install -y jupyter Create the enviroment named torch conda create --name torch python=3.8 # created a conda enviroment named 'torch' After finished, reopen the terminal

item.title: Install Pytorch for GPU and CPU using Conda on Ubuntu
item.description: Install Anaconda or Miniconda depends on your taste. Go to anaconda or miniconda’s website and download the .sh file for your system. Go into the terminal use “chmod +x filename” command to the .sh file then run it. Always click yes to finish installation. Install jupyter conda install -y jupyter Create the enviroment named torch conda create --name torch python=3.8 # created a conda enviroment named 'torch' After finished, reopen the terminal

item.title: Run YOLO v5 on Jetson developer kit step by step tutorial
item.description: What’s the goal? To run YOLOv5 on jetson developer kit to achieve real-time object detection. The following instructions has been tested on: Jetson nano Jetson Xavier NX What you need: A Jetson nano (If you are using other Jetson developer kit from Nvidia, I am sure you can take this as reference as well.) A SD card and power suply which meets the needs. Another computer or laptop with internet
